20101229011026.000|20101229011029.000|TR0|HOFMEISTER:  The answer, Eliot, is to 
20101229011029.000|20101229011031.000|TR0|raise production.  If the companies could

20101229012028.000|20101229012030.000|TR0|Afghanistan is pointless.  Why do you say 
20101229012030.000|20101229012032.000|TR0|that?       FAIR:  Well, I think there are 
20101229012032.000|20101229012035.000|TR0|a number of reasons.  First of all, the 
20101229012035.000|20101229012037.000|TR0|known estimates of al Qaeda operatives in 
20101229012037.000|20101229012039.000|TR0|Afghanistan range anywhere from 50 to 200. 
20101229012039.000|20101229012042.000|TR0| And that's it.  Al Qaeda's largely 
20101229012042.000|20101229012044.000|TR0|shifted to Pakistan.  That's where the al 
20101229012044.000|20101229012046.000|TR0|Qaeda struggle is.
20101229012046.000|20101229012048.000|TR0|
20101229012048.000|20101229012051.000|TR0|The Taliban are not as tightly interwoven 
20101229012051.000|20101229012053.000|TR0|with al Qaeda as often imagined.  And the 
20101229012053.000|20101229012055.000|TR0|Taliban, quite frankly, are not our enemy. 
20101229012055.000|20101229012057.000|TR0| And I think that they're -- I mean, look, 
20101229012057.000|20101229012100.000|TR0|they're savages, for sure.  I'm not in any 
20101229012100.000|20101229012102.000|TR0|way exculpating them from their savagery,

20101229012104.000|20101229012106.000|TR0|

20101229012109.000|20101229012111.000|TR0|which are Pakistan based, they are our 
20101229012111.000|20101229012113.000|TR0|enemy and there is this enormous irony 
20101229012113.000|20101229012116.000|TR0|that by virtue of having 150-ish troops,

20101229012122.000|20101229012125.000|TR0|means that we are absolutely restricted in

20101229015127.000|20101229015129.000|TR0|really been willing to stick their neck
